page.title: 07MARLEY HALL AREA
page.content: {Marley Hall}is a 1,000 acre arable estate run by a manager. One of the main crops is{peas grown for freezing. A new road had to be made on the farm to accommodate the modern machinery required for picking and podding the peas. The land of nearby{Quatsford}was incorporated into Marley Hall, the house being retained by the owner. The present house was previously the domestic offices and the original T- shaped house can be seen in the remaining foundations. An old kitchen {hearth back}now in the sitting room is dated{1629}and was probably cast in the Forest of Dean. It has a rope edge Fleur de Lis, and initials IWI. {Jugs Green}buildings are used for hop drying. . {Woodhouse}is a small mixed farm. {Baregains}Farm is grass and cattle.
